Gender Equality:
Gender equality is the state in which individuals of all genders have equal rights, responsibilities, and opportunities. It is essential for the development of peaceful, inclusive, and resilient societies. Gender equality is not only a fundamental human right, but a necessary foundation for a peaceful, prosperous and sustainable world.

The Wikipedia article on Gender Equality provides an excellent overview. The UN Women Facts and Figures give insight into the global status of women's representation.

Freedom of Speech:
Freedom of speech is the right to articulate one's opinions and ideas without fear of government retaliation or censorship. It is a cornerstone of democratic societies and is protected under various constitutions and international agreements.
